summary: Private pilots and plane owners have raised concerns about how much fuel and other aviation services cost at airports. The statistical model we developed found that, at busy airports, aviation fuel prices were higher when there was less competition between service providers, in particular where there was only one provider. However, not all airports have enough demand to support multiple providers. While FAA oversees airport...
title: Airports: Information on Prices for Aviation Services and FAA's Oversight of Grant Requirements
